ARABIC: فَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ وَكُن مِّنَ ٱلسَّٰجِدِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: So glorify your Lord with praise and be one of the prostrators.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: But you should glorify your Lord with praises, and be among those who bow in submission;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: When (you feel so) glorify your Lord with His praise and prostrate yourself before Him,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Glorify and praise your Lord and be with those who prostrate themselves before God.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Therefore proclaim the Purity of your Lord with praise, and be of those who prostrate.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: So glorify the praises of your Lord and be of those who prostrate themselves (to Him).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Therefore celebrate the praise of your Lord, and be of those who make obeisance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Proclaim thy Lord's praise, and be of those that bow,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: But hymn the praise of thy Lord, and be of those who make prostration (unto Him).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: But glorify your Lord with His praise, and prostrate yourself:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: So hallow thou the praise of thy Lord, and be thou of the prostrate.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: So celebrate the praise of your Lord and be among those who prostrate,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But celebrate the praises of thy Lord, and be of those who prostrate themselves in adoration.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: So glorify the praises of your Lord and be of those who prostrate themselves (to Him).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Exalt with the praise of your Lord and be one of those who prostrate.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: So glorify the praise of your Lord, and be among those who bow down.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord and be of those who prostrate [to Him].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [15:98] So glorify, intimately [repeating], the praise of your Lord, in other words, say subhāna’Llāhi wa-bi-hamdihi — and be of those who prostrate themselves, those who pray;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (But hymn the praise of thy Lord) pray by the command of your Lord, (and be of those who make prostration (unto Him)) of those who prostrate to Him; it is also said that this means: of those who are obedient to Him.
